text: On tap at Wicked Weed Funkatorium in Asheville, NC. Aroma is mild funk, cocoa, dark fruits, some tobacco leaves. Taste is dry cocoa, dark fruit skins, tobacco, oak with some mild funk notes. One of the more flavorful WW sours Ive tried.

(500ml 2016 bottle from boxbeers.dk) Pours a hazy reddish brown with a big, short lived off white head that leaves nice lace. Aroma is heavy on red wine character, sweet and moderately sour at once. Notes of raspberry, blackberry, strong notes of sweet dried dark fruits (dates but also figs etc.), dark cherries, tannic oak, light acetic sherry vinegar quality. Flavour is tart but not sour, charries, raspberries, berry seeds, a little lemon juice, very little acetic acid, fairly neutral wood with subtle wine tones, some crabapple. Fairly dry in the finish, tannic, some berry skins. Light to medium bodied, extremely high carbonation. Promises more on the nose than the flavour delivers, not unusual for WW. Last of my pre-Inbev stock.

A reddish brown color with a pinkish head. The aroma contains some vinegar, cherries, and raspberries. The flavor is only slightly sour and well balanced with some cherries and dark fruit. Not over the top sour and really good
On tap at the Growler Spot. Dark clear reddish. Aroma of tart berries and red wine. Tart, fruity and really balanced. Nice. Damn you InBev. You strike again 😫.

Karmel, owoce jeśne, daktyle, figi, trochę takiej surowej dębowej beczki, lekko taniczne, winne, ściągające. Raczej równowaga między słodyczą, a kwaśnym charakterem z fajnymi akcentami czerwonego wina i owoców leśnych.
Amazing beer. Dark red pour from bottle in Dubuque. Smells like sweet red wine. Taste is cherries, grape; vinegar in a good way, and apple. Love it.
Pours a deep ruby color with a white head. Tart, raspberry, vinegar and date aroma and flavors. Medium light body and medium carbonation with a tart raspberry finish.
Scent is mild with subtle blackberry. Tastes tart, fruity, woody with a dry aftertaste.
Bottle. Poured a deep amberish color with an off white head. Fruity, berries, and the red wine barrel comes out as it opens.

Tap at Cap Tap. Pours darkly ruddy with a light tan head. Aroma is sourish, woody, fruity. Med body at least. Flavor is dark berry, wood, some darkish fruit. Its more tart than sour. Were it raspberry Id be thinking Belgium. Drinks easy. Quite tasty.

On tap at Cap Tap. Pours blueish brown with a nice beige head and a berry aroma. There is a moderately sour dark malt flavor with a lot of blueberry and a tart wine finish. Fairly subtle yet very tasty.

Aromat: mocny i intensywny, czerwone dobre wino półwytrawne i świeże leśne owoce. Bardzo przyjemny aromat. 
Wygląd: przepiękne, krwisto czerwono miedziane, przejrzyste, śliczna pianka na ponad centymetr, biała średnio pęcherzykowa. 
Smak: bardzo cierpkie, smak kwaśniejszy niż aromat. Bardzo wytrawne, cierpkość jak w wytrawnym winie, drewniana taniczność z beczki wywołująca odczucie ściągania na języku. Kwaśność przeważa, bardzo kwaśne wiśnie i kwasek cytrynowy, w kontrze do niej lekka słodycz świeżych owoców leśnych, bardzo wyraźne i dobrze grające tu jeżyny, nadają balans i dobry smak temu piwu. Daktyli nie wyczułem. Szkoda że nie ma trochę więcej słodkich owoców leśnych. Wysycenie średnie w kierunku dużego, słodycz owoców wyczuwalna na końcu języka, w tyle cierpkość. Finisz kwaśny. Ciekawe i niezłe, ale do zachwytu mi daleko
Beers aromatic with marshmallow, perfume, malt, red wine. Flavors not as complex, mainly quite tart, dry, some fruit. Well carbonated which enhances tartness. Good finish.

A great sour, but let it age. It balances much better after at least a few months. Very nice palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, brettanomyces, wood, and berries. The flavor is sweet with notes of wood, brettanomyces, berries, and straw, leading to a tart finish.

Sample from 50 cl bottle. Deep amber colour with a thin, white head. Tart, fruity aroma with dark berries, wooden notes, red wine. Taste is light sour. Medium bodied. Finishes tart fruity with lingering fruity notes.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Red Amber pour with off white head. Medium sour fruity with some prominent blackberry fruit, some berry skin, yeasty notes, some vinegar, wooden accents, nice.

Bottle at yespr.
Clear ruby colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma berries and red wine.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of red wine and berries.
Tart finish.
50 cl. bottle. A hazy dark amber coloured beer with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, tartness, oak, red wine and vinegar.

Tasted from the tap on the 25/03/2017. Hazy copper colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of cherry, tart, sour yeast and some vainilla. Taste of caramel, red fruits and a dry sour tart finish. Long sour finish. Next one please!

Draft:
Hazy copper with a wisp of off-white head.
Woody, berry scent.
Taste is tangy, woody, funky berries.
Rich and tasty.
500ml bottle shared by Ryan and Ella. Murky purple burgundy unfiltered body. Thin, off-white head. Nice berry depth. Blackberry, raspberry. The dates give it nice depth. Solid offering.

500 ml bottle shared, from Mollys Spirits. Reddish amber appearance with a small beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, sour notes, light vanilla and a touch of toasted oak. Similar flavor, fruity, sour and funky with light vinous notes. Rich, tart, puckering mouth feel with a medium body and a smooth finish. Nicely done.

Deep ruby red hazy hue with a thin ivory cap. Brisk sour and earthy rustic woodsy aroma with a little berry tartness throughout. Crisp and semisweet earthy berry tartness full of currant and boysenberry and cherry and woody wild funky sourness. Crisp and flavorfully amazing with the right amount of tartness.

18-FEB-2017, bottle @home, brought by Morten, thx. :-)
Hazy amber with a lasting, tan head.
Wood, red wine, berries, funk.
Tart, creamy, loooong red wine tart finish. Wonderfull.

Tap. Murky dark brown with some reddish tones. Nice sour berry tones, some dates, red grape and oaky sourness in the aroma. Not over the top sour, balanced, decent acidity, oaky, quite berry fruit driven. Lighter to medium body.
Wicked Odense Rating Party. Cloudy red chestnut with a small off-white head. Aroma of dried fruit, red wine, wood and cherry. Dry and tart flavour with earthy red wine, oak, dried fruit
Bottle @ Pours cloudy reddish with a pink head. Aroma of berries, malty, red berries, red wine, cherries, slight tannis, jammy. Taste is rather sour, red berries, funk, vinous, dry wood.
Bottle @ Scheffels Otha fish in the sea Tasting. Pours Deep red with a white head. Juicy red beeries, jammy, funk, Wood and vanilla. Vinous and complex.

Bottle from Turdferguson, dated 9.25.15, drunk 12/17/16.Dark auburn-chestnut with darker mahogany hues, a good clarity and a small, beige head atop flecked with pink, showing moderate retention for the style.Lots of acidity in the nose seems to come primarily from the critters. Brett fruitiness and tartness sits alongside a strong, warming acetic character providing cherry and vinegar, as oak notes deepen the complexity. Blackberry character has subsided somewhat, but still adds poignant acidity and fruitiness. Vanilla and caramel lie behind things, providing light balance. Some alcohol noted and overall quite intense, perhaps a bit aggressive.More given to softer wood tannins and malty caramel notes, with good attenuation but still a supple texture. The acidity builds up quickly though; as theres plenty of it. Fruit, critters, oak, red wine; its all here in force and comes off just a bit too punchy and acidic for my taste. I think with a little less acetic character and maybe a bit less astringency from the tannin, this would be significantly better. As is, I still enjoyed it, it just got too fatiguing by the middle to end.

750ml bottle during a bottle sharing @Pulapka, Gdansk
Brett aroma with red fruit and vinegar. Sour on a medium level, very good drinkability. A lot of forest fruits.

500ml bottle. Funky Brett aroma with notes of blackberry, date and vinous red wine. Pours cloudy reddish-copper colored with a thin tan head that has good retention and some lacing. Starts with sour blackberry flavors with notes of vinous red wine flavors to go along with the lively mouthfeel. Finishes dry with some date and funky Brett flavors before finishing with red wine tannins linger on the palate. Nice sour.

Colour: coppery and red, hazy
Foam: very high, fine bubbles, quite durable. 
Smell: like smelling a wine cabernet/merlot from Chile  full of sweet blackberries, also barrel is well present. Actually, aroma is really close to wines and so pleasant. Maybe I would like this even more if there would be more green notes from hops..?
Also dried hints of maltiness, fruits and cherries, noble bouquet  not that often associated with beers.
Taste: quite a full, intense notes of dark berries and dried fruits, vinegar. High saturation, velvet carbonation and long sour finish. 
woody,
Great one, after couple sips, blackberries are really nice in taste. A bit wine-like also.

Bottle poured into a goblet showing brownish red with very sparse clean white lacing. 

The nose shows dark fruits of blackberries with hints of cherries and currants with tart notes of steel tank in between. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Dry but forward blackberries with a light tannic edge that transitions into a red wine bitterness. Moderately tart throughout. Finish are astringent red wine tannins.

24th November 2016Grand tasting at Craft Islington with Hackobock. Thanks to Matteo. Hazy amber beer, small cream colour head. Palate is airy and dry, decent carbonation. Tangy sour fruits. Red wine tang. A musty Port Wine vibe. Light lemon. Airy dry finish. Tangy fruity linger. Decent.

On tap at the Funkatorium: brown pour, purple tint. aroma of sour cherry, grapes, wine. tastes are red wine, oak, berry. moderate even vinegar tart. delicious. medium palate. bit dry. dark fruit, wood, blackberry.

Bottle shared at the Hackobock tasting at Craft Islington. Thanks to MattyO! It pours hazy red - brown with a medium tan head. The aroma is soft, sweet, tangy, sticky, dried fruits, fruit cake, vanilla, wood and toffee. The taste is crisp, tart, tangy, green apple skin, lemon peel, sherbet, sour candy, berry, red grape skin, vanilla and some bright acidity. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Rather tasty stuff.

Was quite late evening, so my notes are quite blurry, tho I liked it. Lovely maltiness in backgorund, some berries, juicy cherry, kinda dry wood impact, bit vinous but not too pushy.
Moderate tartness with some sweetness. Liked it, but would lke to try as first of session

November 2015 - Bottle share at CBC Islington. Thanks Matteo! As Wicked Weed Oblivion Sour Red, 8.7%. Reddy brown, hazy and opaque with a foamy tan head, full lacing. Aroma is vinegar, oaky, thin red wine. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is peach, oak, cherry, tangy sour, vinous. Very good. (4.0)

Bottle shared at the Craft beer Co tasting 24/11/2016. Many thanks to Matteo for this one. . A hazed amber brown coloured pour with a lasting light tan head. Aroma is nice bretty funk with a little sour lacto, nutty malts. Flavour is composed of tangy. Sour, granny Smith apple, nutty malts, berry fruits. Palate light spritz, tangy. Good.

Started foaming out of the bottle before i even poured it. Lots of dark fruits on the nose. A medium- high sourness with some nice oaky-wine character to it. Can definitely taste the dates, less so the blackberries. Pretty tasty

50ml bottle shared at the Hackobock tasting, Craft Islington. Sourced via Beer Gonzo. It pours a clean copper color with a medium beige head. Aroma is sour and sweet with nice red wine and vanilla notes. Taste is also sweet tangy acidic with notes of red berries lemon peel and vanilla. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice

From a bottle into a pint glass. Nice red color with medium off white head. Nose is cherry, tart apples, funk. Medium body, good carbonation, medium to high sour notes, and medium funk. Wonderfully complex and delicious beer.
Draft at Wicked Weed Funkatorium, Asheville, NC. Pour is burgundy with an off-white head. Aroma and taste of dark berries, vinous, oak. Acidic, tart finish. Excellent.

Merci à Yan pour le partage. Robe couleur caramel doré, bien claire pour le style. Un profil aromatique plutôt incongrus où des bactéries indigènes sen donnent à coeur joie dans un gâteau. Je peine à ressentir du vin. Aucune ligne directrice ne guide mes sens. Je ne comprends pas où le brasseur cherche à memmener avec cette bière riche qui me brûle loesophage. Encore une de ces bières à la fois bien sucrées et très acides qui me rappelle un haut le coeur de dessert.
UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Aroma: oak, toffee, red grapes, barnyard, Taste: medium sour, light sweet, barnyard, leather, berries

500 ml bottle poured a hazy reddish amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of caramel, berries, vinous notes and light oak. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of caramel, vinous notes, light berry and light oak with a crisp dry tart lingering vinous finish.

Bottle
Aroma-dates, berries, barnyard
Appearance-red, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
Think about the best sour red youve ever had. Got it? Oblivion is twice as good as what you can figured out!

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 (bottle)Aroma: lovely sweet red wine smell,caramel,quite tannicAppearance:red color,small dense yellowish head.Taste:medum sweet,flavour of wine,caramel and raspberries,malty and tannic fnish.Palate:medium body,oily texture,low to medium carbonation.Overall:Veery nice complex red sour,

Bottle. Mahogany with a cola head. Dry, light dates and blackberries, tannin, some oak, light funk and tartness with a constant presence of sour malt. Moderate carbonation and body, fruity and dry finish with some sourness and a nice tart ending.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity sour berry and woody wine aroma. Fruity sour tart woody berry wine flavor. Has a fruity sour tart woody berry finish.

Bottle, 8.7%. Unclear dark amber/brown with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, berries, sour, wood and red wine. Flavour is malt, sour, berries, red wine, lemon, sour fruit, citric, little dry, medium sweet and a little acid.

Bottle @ MTG II tasting at Richs Welfare Pad. Pours hazy orange, foamy head. Not much in the aroma. Taste is woody with a good red wine presence but lacks complexity with little in the way of the promised blackberries or dates. Also not particularly sour. Kinda disappointing.

Bottle shared at the Midlands Tasting Group. Hazy Amber beer with small head. Aroma is fruity, wood and a little red wine. Taste is red berries, a little wood, blackberries, malts and red wine. Top 50? Disappointing.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at RBESG 2016 Grand Tasting Part 2, Brew Pub Le Sec. Very hazy amber to light brown with an off white head. Aroma of tart blackberries, dates coming out, citric notes, tart red berries and light funk. Flavour is light sweet and moderate sour. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation. [10-07-2016]

Bottle from Beer Gonzo shared during Midlands Tasting Group at Richs Welfare pad; hazy golden brown pour with a thin off white head, aroma has some woodiness and tart fruits, taste has almonds, some cherry sticky dates.
Czerwone, owocowo winne z nutą starego drewna w aromacie, dość kwaśkowe w smaku, przy tym mocno owocowe (czerwone owoce), do tego sporo tanin, cierpkości, wytrawnego wina, pięknie ułożony alkohol...
Aromat of wine, oak, red fruits. Taste is light sour, light sweet, light dry. Flavor of wine, berries, tanin barrel. Great.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Oblivion by Wicked Weed Brewing at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaOblivion - duzo owocow, flanderso bdsa, winne, cierpkie, jezynowe, zbalansowane to wszystko super, alko sups schowane, klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Beautiful clear red color with fizzy half-finger head. Smell of raspberry. Taste is red wine and berries. Low sweetness. Quite dry and tart. Good but pricey.
A beautiful red color. Aromas of raspberries and blackberries intermingle with the red wine and finish with delicious fruit.

Bottle 500ml. @ pre. Danish (Ulfborg) Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, TNO(U)DRBSG16 @ fonefan & Brugmasia House.  [ As Wicked Weed Oblivion Sour Red ].Clear medium red - orange amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, sweet malt, tart, berry, date, wod, sharp blackberry. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, tart berry, wood, fruity malt, caramel, medium dry, dates, blackberry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160819]
Aromas of red wine and berries. Taste is red wine, berries, and dates. Very tart and dry.

Bottled at TNOD(U)RBSG2016. Cloudy copper colour, mid sized head. Oaky vanilla aroma with tart blackberries. Tart with vinegary sourness and medium body, rounded spritzy mouthfeel. Vinegary raspberries and vanilla. Low bitterness.

Sampled @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, Friday, Day 1


37.5cl bottle. Pours hazy dark orange golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of ripe and tart red berries, vanilla, wood. Taste of red fruits, tart berries, vanilla, wood, sweet finish, good!

Milde, sehr fruchtige Säure von Beeren. Vollmundig, spritzig, sehr weich. Später werden Aromen von Vanille und Wein erkennbar, die Säure steigt deutlich an. Fruchtiger Nachgeschmack, angenehme Säure. 9/13/13/12/10/13

Sampled from bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Gathering Ulfborg 2016, Day 1. HAzy red amber color, medium to full sized beige head. Aroma is sourish, sourish red fruit, but in a good way. Taste is moderately sour, sour red fruits but quite balanced. Dont specifically get the blackberries or the red wine barrels, but no doubt it has influenced the flavor. And not in a bad way, its pretty nice.

Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, fonefan. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is amber/red. Aroma and taste are sour malt, fruits, berries, caramel and hops. Nice fruity sour finish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy amber red with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, sour fruit, red wine and wood. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 190816

10th July 2016. Bottle at RBESG Grand Tasting Part 2: Brew Pub Le Sec. Slight red hue to the dark amber, hazy pour: wispy head. Aroma had red fruits and wine like esters in its make-up. fairly sour and tart on the palate with dark berries leading the flavour, became sweeter as it warmed a little.

Pours a really delicate looking deep amber with off white head. Lots of aroma of dates, sour cherries and oak etc. The taste is very sour and lightly sweet up front. The sourness seems to dominate quite a lot. But sipping along the complexity of the beer shows and notes of the blackberries and dates among others seem to join the party. I really like it!
Bottle. Pours a dark reddish color. Aroma and taste are grapes, red wine, and dates. Very dry finish.

Pours a clear red with a thin offwhite head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of red grapes and balsamic vinegar. Taste is of grapes again, red wine, winey oak and light vinegar. Classy. Moderate body and carbonation. Vinous like it should. I really enjoyed this one!

500 mL bottle shared by Gus. The pour is a darker ruby/dark brown color with a thin khaki head and a thick ring. The aroma is full of sour blackberry and a very vinous wineyness. The crisp fruitiness is nice and balances with the wet wine barrel. The flavor is a little more wine barrel controlled with a light fruitiness and a lingering sweet barrel. Its interesting. As it warms, its not as fruity or tart we Id like it to be. The mouth feel is thin and light with a crisper carbonation and a lingeringly fruity barrel on the back end. Its an interesting brew for sure.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! pours unclear bright red with a small light beige cap offering some retention and lacing. caramelized prunes, cherries, red wine, wood, light to medium acidity - complex flora, some acetic but never overwhelming; minerals. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet and woody-spicy finish. very nice fruit sour red.

Bottle (500 ml). Clear deep red with a small fully lasting white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is of blackberries, red wine, raisins/dates, caramel-ish notes and oak spiciness. Taste is moderately sour with blackberries, raisins/dates, red wine, caramel notes but not much sweetness and cherries. Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Winey mouthfeel with some oak. Fruity finish. Good wine forward Sour Red but lack depth a bit.

Dampolla al Grand Tasting del RBESG16. Cervesa color coure vermellós amb aromes inicials de sofre (H2S) que marxen ràpidament. Apareixen aromes de gra, mora àcida, un punt acètic i de vi i també vainilla. En boca també es àcida i afruitada amb aromes de cirera, mora i més vi. Bona!

Bottle. It pours hazy amber with a creamy beige head. Loads of berries in aroma. Blackberries and unripe strawberry. Wood and cobwebs. Tart fruity flavor with tart berry notes. Some sweetness in the finish that could be from the dates. Else its mostly dominated by tart black berries. A bit unrefined but tasty still.

Bottle shared. Hazy dark red with pale pink head. Sour cherries, light bitter herbs, more fresh red fruit, Brett, red wine and some oak. Medium sour and light bitter with a very light sweetness. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Too bitter maybe but still quite nice.
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, peachy and fruity. Dry, wooden and smooth fruity. Dry and fruity. Lingering citric and smooth fruity finish.
Bottle. Darkish red color. Berries. Oak. Medium acidic sour. Dried fruit. The dates really come through. Touch of funk. Decent sour.

Bottle, from b3shine-- thanks Beau!-- shared at game night. Hazy deep mahogany hue with an off white head. Terrific sour unripened blackberry flavour with vinous undertones and elements of dark fruits, wood, and spices. Great flavours across the palate, with a sourness that isnt bracing or harsh.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: A reddish copper brown ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, nice pungent fruity malt with acidity, light Brett, light lactic notes, light caramel, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet tart malt with light ground cherry, light Brett, light lactic notes, nice and smooth. Bottle at Matts.

American oud bruin with blackberry and dates, bottle at BeerTemple, generously shared by Ilse from Craft & Draft, cheers! Lightly lacing, moussy, egg-white head, mahogany to chestnut brown robe. Rich and seductive aroma of indeed blackberry and candied date, embedded in hints of blue plum, toffee, rum-soaked raisins, medium dry sherry, hazelnut oil, some cocoa. Sourish and sweetish onset, raisin and fig impressions next to recognizable date and blackberry hints, medium carbo, smooth and full caramelly and nutty malt body providing underlying sweetness and rotundity against an unripe stonefruit tartness softly drying the mouth, nice tart and juicy finish with persisting dried fruit flavors. Ilse clearly knew which one to pick to share with us: this is a truly brilliant example of the style, as it combines gentle but adequate sourness with a well-rounded, opulent malt sweet underground, a combination typical for some of the greatest Belgian examples of the style as well. A real gem.

Dark amber purple in color... Aroma of vanilla, dates, blackberries, caramel, notes of Bourbon in the nose... Flavor is caramel, berries, dates, vinous notes, light red wine oak on palate... Lightly tart... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy brown liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of wood, blackberries, apple skin, lemon and light vinegar. Taste is very light sweet and medium sour with notes of lemon, apple skin, blackberries and wood. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

Bottle shared by a friend on his birthday. Happy birthday Brett! Clear copper pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of malt, dark fruit and sourness. Malty flavor with blackberry and date character before a sour finish.

50 cl bottle (8.7% abv) @ Timo A. Bottled on 25.09.2015.
Pours dark orange color with a small head. Sour berries on the nose, some yeast, wood. Flavor has also blackberries with nice sourness, some vinous notes with wood and faint dates. Nice. 
3345

500 ml bottle. Bottled on 9/25/15. Courtesy of Euphemos. Thanks!!!
Hazy brown color with a small tan head.
Berries, sourness, cherries and some sweetness in the aroma. 
The flavor is tartness, sourness, red berries, dryness and some balancing sweetness. 
Balanced and rich. Yummy! 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ Schnapps snifter ][ 03.25.16 ]
hazy red-chestnut, thick large bubbled cream head lasts. Heavy berry and red wine, brown sugar oude bruin element. Fizzy black cherry front palate, lightly waxy as sweet, watery mid before stinging sugar and berry dark/sweetness ends the beer. Acid and sugar controlled, fruit expressive. One of the better Wicked Weed sours.

Bottle at home - shared by Mette. Clear deep dark red - offwhite head. Nice sourness. Red grapes. Funky. Rubber. Blackberries. Light fat date notes. Wooden notes. Tannins. Nice fruity/berrie/juicy. Some sour cherry like notes. Light malty taste. Umami....
Reddish brown. Nose of funky red wine with balsamic vinegar and salty dates. Flavor is sour, funky red grape with light burnt sugar, faint blackberry, and distinct dates. Sour, tangy finish.

Bottle thanks to cgarvieuk dregs run. 
Appearance - cloudy dark brown. 
Nose - wood and sour toffee. 
Taste - tangy herby red fruit or olives. Salt. Wood lurking. 
Palate - medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry tangy finish. 
Overall - acidic dry start. Some fruit in the middle and then it goes back to the bitter olive.

Big hazy mahogany red and a neat fluffy off white cuff. Nose is puffy berry, charred hungover red wine. Initial taste is a tarry sweetness, proper oaky dryness and spicy Jolly rancher sweetness. Carbonation is sleek and mouthfeel rich and a decent kick from the tartness. Finishes strongly tart, very a rich warming winey funk. Linger is a bit more warming spice but more of the same. Mmmmmmm.Bottle, CGarvieUK 10th Anniversary Tasting
Pours deep burgundy purple with a minimal head. Aroma is cherry and raspberry. Taste is cherry sweel, cherry tart, modest acidity.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep amber, nose is funky, cherry, berry, oak, taste is dry, tart, sour cherry, nice.
bottle at home ... dark copper .. thin tan lacing ... soft sweet toffee .. soft toffee sweet malt nose ... tart fruit .. big sour fruit .. soft fruit .. tart balasamic .. soft cherry
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear cherry red with a thin creamy head. Aromas of red fruit, almonds, light sour. Taste is sour, red fruit. Light vinegar, in a good way. Tasty, if expensive.

500ml bottle into small snifter glass, clear darker ruby-amber color with light tan head. Aroma notes of sour berries, red wine, oak, apple and vanilla. Taste adds cider vinegar, red apples, blackberries, dried fruits and citrus. Light-medium body, moderate carbonation, dry, crisp, almost astringent with fruity dry finish. Pretty red wine dry yet fruity sour, very good.

Bottle. reddish dark amber with small yellowish small head. Aroma: soap, berries, balsamico, hay, cow shit. Taste: medium+ sour with some smooth sweetness, black currant, berries, acid. Sor-spicy finish. Nicely balanced. Good beer.

Reddish brown 1 finger off white head. Almost no aroma except a red wine infection. Has a Flemish red ale taste but with a bit more malts than it should have. Sour is toned down. Wood and wine undertones

Pours murky brown with low off white head 
Aromas tart of sour cherries, oak, red grapes, red apples 
Taste has subtle tart notes of sour cherries, red apples, hints bicarbonate, sour grapes

Pours reddish brown with a medium foamy tan head. Aromas of red grapes, red apples, almonds, cherries . Taste is funky and fruity with a malty moderate sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Tart and dry with a crispy note.

Pours hazy deep brown with low tan head. Aroma of sour cherries, baking soda, red grapes, burgundy barrels. Taste is medium to rich tart with a mellow sweet finish. Light and smooth body with average carbonation.

Bottle share. Pours a black cherry color, clearish, foamy off-white head. Aroma of berries, red wine, wood, tartness. Flavor had blackberry, raspberry, wine, oak, tart, sour. Light body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, tart and dry finish.

Bottle. Pours dark copper with a red tint. Aroma is dark fruit, mixed berries, oak, acidity, caramel, and some faint vanilla. Flavor is juicy and tart with great dark fruit flavor throughout with mostly neutral barrel notes and some light sweetness. Medium body.

Fairly traditional flanders style sour. The cherry isnt the focal point, the barreling and funk is, but they do come through nicely. The figs are overpowered, but add a nice touch of complexity in the finish.

50cl bottle pours a murky brown with some spitty, off white head. Nose has acid, raisins, some cherries, apple cider vinegar, some heavy barrel. Flavor is tart with vinegar and blood orange, dried fruit. Tart finish. Solid.

50cl bottle, thanks Kevin. Medium beige head atop cloudy garnet body. Aroma is moderately sweet, funk, sour berry. Taste is moderately sweet, funk, blackberry, some sour. Light-medium body, light acidity, stickiness.
Caoba turbio y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de frutos negro, madera húmeda, bota de vino. Cuerpo denso, sabor de acidez punzante, mora, fruto rojo y final seco.

500 mL bottle from The Hop Yard, Raleigh (bottled April 3, 2015). Reddish-brown pour with a quick khaki head. Tart nose of dark fruit, oak, and red wine. Great sour taste of blackberry jam, apple cider vinegar, merlot, damp wood, and Earth. Sour fruit lingers on the palate but is less harsh because of the oak presence and perhaps due to the age of the bottle. An excellent Oud Brune from Wicked Weed.

Pours dark reddish brown with a light yellowish head. Nose is dominantly mineral and fruity. Citric but with some vanilled oaky notes. Taste is pretty stoney, mineral with plums and dark fruits - a little leather and finished with dine oak tanins as well. Body is light with a full frizzy carbonation. First go at Wicked Weed.
Murky brownish red. Nose is some dark berries, and light wine barrel. Flavors of funky red fruit, medium sourness, some wine barrel. Good but indistinct.

Pour slightly murky nutty brown, with a small white head. 
Aroma is slightly mineral forward, with black berries In hede as Well, slight barrel, ever so sligh funk. 
Taste is dominantly sour, with a bit of fruity sweetness to it. 
Medium bodied, with a somewhat fizzy carbonation.
Thanks, Carl. Tried at an awesome Wicked Weed tasting. Nice dark red brown color. Oak, red wine, berries, decently tart and funky.

Backlog from the Funkatorium. Poured almost black brown, slight head. Aroma was dark fruit, hints of vanilla, cherry, blackberry. Tart. Flavor matches. Another really good brew from these guys. At this point in the tasting, I was starting to be a bit shocked at just how good across the board and across multiple disparate styles these guys are.

Thank you Mathieu87 & PriorL! 500 ml. bottle sampled @ Mathieus house cooling party. Bottled on 01.20.15. Dark red amber , off-white / patchy tanned head. Nose is sour fizzy, glue, lactic, oak, sugar, red fruit jell-o & jam. Taste is fizzy sour glue notes, big sweetish red fruit, jam, sugar, jell-o, very lactic, oak, fizzy, Fizzy jam body. Nice fizzy strongly lactic Oud Bruin with strong jam & glue notes. Honestly I expected a bit more looking at the deScription. This is good but I feel like it could have been more. 3rd time that I have a Wicked Weed beer & this is the 3rd time I feel like that. Odd.

11/15/15. 500mL bottle during Ryans epic birthday tasting! Amber pour with a nice khaki head, good lacing. Nice aroma, mild sweetness mixes with tartness, funk, tannic oak and wine, vanilla. Nice flavor, good balance of sweet and tart, berries, dark fruits, wine, oak, vanilla, funk. Yum!

Just an amazing sour. Full of jammy notes and a just right sour palate. Spot on.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep redish amber color with a fine foam head. The aroma is of red wine, blackberry, wood, with a very soft funk scent. Flavor is of tart semi sweet blackberries, red grapes, dates. It is a rather good blending of flavors. I enjoyed the dry finish. Overall a nicely done beverage.

bottle shared to glass. poured a medium garnet color clear with little carbonation. slight whitish head. the aroma was of blackberry, tart, slight funk dark fruits and wood. the flavor oh soooo smooth. subtle flavors of blackberry, wine, and dark fruits melded together in a bottle. absolutely wonderful flavors. not overly sour at all. just amazing.
bottle thanks to Shad, yum yum yum. I love what red wine barrels do to sours. The tannins and tartness are balanced with the dates and berries. Very very nice.

Draft at the brewery during RBWG 2014 - Asheville. Pours clear, deep gold with a creamy head. Great stuff, very well balanced, with moderate acidity, pleasant dried fruits, berries. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Balanced finish, acidic and quenching. Solid.

Bottle from the brewpub. Pours a purple color with no head. This beer is extra vinous. Light Balsamic notes mix with oak, red wine, and berries. Mouthfeel is medium and finishes bone dry. This is very complex and balanced. This could take the place of red wine in any occassion for me. What an expertly brewed beer.
From a bottle at the RB DC tasting September 6. It is a clear light amber with a slight head. The aroma is sour cherries and the taste is sour but not describable flavor
From a bottle at the RB DC tasting September 6. Pours a clear deep amber with an off white head. Flavors of dates and tart berries. Slight tart finish.
Mahogany / crimson body with a quarter inch of khaki head. Aromas of dark cherry, oak, funk, vanilla. Similar flavor, mild acetic character. Medium bodied, mild cherry sweetness. Nice.

Pours opaque cheatnut with a nice light tan head. Sour fruit and wood dominate he tempting flavor. FlVor is seriously sour, if not enough to make your face do calisthenics; fruity and subtle woody hop notes are in evidence plus just a snip of malt. Firm body has lively, sassy fizz to spare. Enjoy - but please not to oblivion. (And if you do, please call a taxi.)

500 ml bottle, 7 months old, bottled 01.20.15. Pours our burgundy.brown with minimal beige head. Nose is tart fruit and wood. Taste is balanced tart, dark fruits and lots of wood, some molasses and bread. Tastes almost like a sour barrel-aged quad. Feels light, but its not. Hard to believe its 8.7% abv.

Draft at funkatorium. Pours ruby red with a thin white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Nice red wine and Brett notes on the nose and the tongue. Nicely balanced. Hides it's nearly 9% very well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Brown colour with off white head. Fruity, cherry, wine aroma. Sour, cherry, fruity, wine taste. Medium body.

Aroma: Red Wine, Tart Cherry Juice

Appearance: Dark Brown/Reddish Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Red Wine Barrel, Tart Cherry, Mild Cranberry

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Drying
Clear cherry cola color. Good head with nice lace. Fruit additions keep this funky beer from being too sour and tannic.

Keg at the Funkatorium, 17/02/15.
Lightly hazed chestnut brown with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is bitter cherry, funk, spice, straw, earthy, damp hay.
Taste comprises wood must, bitter citric shred, light varnish, funky, tarte red berry.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, light acidic ride and puckering close.
Solid Flanders, good balance.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from bfeld, pour was brown red with a nice off white to tan pink head. Aroma of red wine, cherries, leather. Flavor followed with funk, tannins, horse blankets, finishing tart and sour with a bite and acidity and dryness in the mouthfeel. Light body and low carbonation.
on tap at huna day pours a dark red amber with zero head. blackberry, dates and oak taste with a very acidic finish

Pour is deep dark red with a brown edge and a good bit of light tan head with some larger bubbles. Nose has a rubber phenol, dark berry jam, and a light vinous quality. Flavor is a bit harsh, higher acidity, rubber, dirty malt, and some blackberry jam. Finish is a bit acetic, moderate carb, granular feel.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Wicked Weed DC Debut event. Poured a dark ruby color with a small white head. Aroma is light dried, dark fruits. Light acid, tart berries. Some mild vinegar on the finish. Interesting.
Lots of sour plum and a touch of raspberry. Finishes very tart. Dark ruby pour with good head. Ok package, but preferred the red angel. Tangy finish. Tap at Churchkey.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Wicked Weed DC Debut event. Reddish brown with off-white head. Aromas of tart notes, vinegar, berries, floral notes. Tastes of tart notes, berries, vinegar. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Pours a translucent brick-amber into the glass, with a wispy head that reduces to light ring lacing. Soured malts and acidic berries to the nose. Flavors are very similar, soured malt, acidic berries, tart esters, vinous notes, all which finish a nice curt sour of unripened berries and stone fruits. Lively on the palate, medium-bodied and a vinous mouthfeel, this is a great wild Flanders Red. Still great things coming from the Wicked Weeds Funkatorium. Spot on for the style, complex and substantive, this is one sour fans wont want to miss. Superb!
Bottle. Thanks Wayne! Pours a murky reddish brown with a thin ring of beige head. Aroma of tartness, dark fruit, and wood. Taste of tart, berries, wood, with some malts tossed in.
Bottle. Light floral grass and toffee malt aroma. Brown with minimal head. Sweet funky horseblanket and light berry toffee malt flavor. Tasty.

bottle. Light reddish brown with small head. Sour, with a big red wine hit that lingers. Substantial tart berry with a dry finish. I feel like the base beer is a bit overwhelmed here, but this is an excellent beer.

Bottle. Murky red with solid white head. Aroma of berry and lemon tang.

Taste follows cant detect date but its a nice fruit sour

This brew pours a clear dark red color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily to a wispy film. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of berries, funky yeast and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of vine fruits, brett yeast and biscuit malt. The finish is moderately sour with an oak and berry aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Bottle. Date bottled 4.3.15. Pours a cedar wood color with a light tan head. Fruity, jelly like aroma. Medium mouthfeel. Caramel, raspberry, and the red wine comes out as well. Not sure I could really pick out the dates. Tasty. 8.5% doesnt really show.

On tap at apex. Pours a clear reddish brown color with a medium white head. A big sour woody nose. Rich berries, oak, robust sour cherry. Great flemish brown sour, but the core is very sweet cherries. Awesome.

Tap at Apex, post CBC

A: Opaque red body, thin off-white head.

N: Cherry, some balsamic vinegar, acetone, oak, nail polish, red wine grape, some leather, hint of charred barrel, and noticeable diacetyl as the beer warms.

T: Quite tart, light sweetness.

M: Light body, prickly carbonation, hidden alcohol.

O: Decently complex attempt at Flanders Red. Its very drinkable, and except for the one flaw, well done.
Bottle at Wicked Weed. Poured a ruby tone with light pink head. Flavor is sour berry, sugar. Tart. Another great Wicked Weed sour.

Bottle. Murky reddish brown pour with a small head that fades to a messy ring. Somewhat faint aroma but good. Cherries, oak, red wine, and balsamic. Tastes like balsamic, grape skins, and oak mostly. Some red fruit too. Light sourness, moderate tartness in the finish. Good but nothing special.
Tap @ Funkatorium. Copper with decent head and lacing. Smells like an Old Fashioned. Tastes tart but then sweet. Tart then round.

A nice deep sour aroma. The color is a beautiful burgundy with a tan/white head that dissipates fairly quickly. A nice medium body with effervescent carbonation. The taste starts tart and sour but that falls off fairly quickly giving way to the refreshing quality of blackberries, which evolves into a slightly leathery/oaky aftertaste. This beer is complex and fucking delicious.
On tap at Funkatorium. Mild aroma of sour cherries and brown sugar. Lovely sweet dark fruit tastes with an awesome tart bite. Fantastic sour.
Deep maroon pour. Small almost tan head. No lacing. Aromas of dark fruit, funk and sweet malt. Taste is malty up front followed by a very tart berry note.

Tap. Poured clear dark ruby color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt and dark fruit with an small alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted complex sour flavor with a medium to heavy complex sour finish of moderate to long duration. This beer also exceeded my expectations.

Pours a translucent dark red with a creamy light brown head. The aroma has a bold musty Brett yeast odor, a note of blackberries, a red vinous scent and a bit of cask. This brew begins with a strong sour berry flavor, then a funky yeastiness creeps in with the finish being sweetly tart with a slight red wine presence...
www.facebook.com/KAJIIsBeerReviews
Very nice sour beer without being overwhelming. I liked the blackberry flavor. This was almost a dessert beer, so it is nice as one serving but not a six pack or session beer. Recommended.

It pours a deep ruby color with a brown head, It has a sour aroma with dried fruits, cherries, and earthly notes. It has a sour taste with flavors that are tart. It has dried fruit flavors and a sour aftertaste. This is a quality beer if you like this style.
On tap at the Funkatorium. Murky brown pour with a kaki head. Vinous bouquet. Lots of vinous notes up front that give way to sour berry notes. Good mouthfeel and body.
draft at Funktorium, Asheville, NC. Nice flanders red. notes of wood, red wine, lots of dark fruit, balsamic. Nice
Dark in color with plum hues and medium to high carbonation. Aroma is that of dark fruit, light hints of leather. Flavor is of tart cherries, sour raspberries, and potentially blueberries.
Bottle. pours dark pink with white head. Aroma is light tart and dark fruits. taste is one note light sour with dates, light tart and dry finish.
Murky brown pour. Small head. Oak, red wine, dark fruit aroma and taste. Medium body. Well done

shared bottle by a friend. poured the darkest deep red colour with a smaller white head. lots of red fruits up front, sour cherries, vinegar, oak, dates, bit of a caramel sweetness, figs. small tart hint, bit of a sour apple, oak, red wine, bit of a dry aftertaste. tasty beer

Bottle from the source. Pours a deep red. Looks great. Lots of berry fruit. Tangy light sour pungent. Aroma has a little wood and wild yeast. Finish is a little stinky cheese funk again and a little wine grape finish. Pretty diverse. The flavors come through but some clash too harshly. Mainly brett and wine barrels. Those two not so good here. The berry and fruit make this worth it still.
Bottle shared by Keith. Nose is lightly Apple with some cherry. Lightly tart. Hazy light brown. Small white head. Taste is lightly tart. A nice refreshingly tartness though. Easy to drink.

Draft sampled at GABf 2014. Pours a deep reddish amber with light white lacing. Aroma is sour cherry, balsamic vinegar, woody oak and additional fruit. Mouthfeel is nicely tart and slightly puckering with lots of dark fruit, cherries, light vinegar (thankfully not overbearing), dusty oak and funk.

Bottle: Poured a hazy deep bright amber color ale with a medium size foamy head with OK retention. Aroma of sour notes with some vinous notes and some light berry notes. Taste is also dominated by tart notes with some vinous red wine notes also perceptible. Body is about average with good carbonation. Very interesting beer with loads of complexity. Dates are noticeable but do not play a huge role in this beer.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 Flight at Funkatorium on my bday. Loved it. Best of the bunch. Totally reminiscent of red wine. Earthy, sour, tart and sweet? with notes of dates and berries. Super interesting. Must drink more and get to the bottom of this one.
04/15  Bottle at home.  Not as good.  Sort of faded away.  Seems to have more character/interest on tap.  Still love it at Funkatorium. One of the best offerings they have.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2016 2016 notes:  Bottle.  Pours a deep ruby to cola brown with a thin tan head.  Big acid, fruit, a bit of wood on the nose.  Medium-bodied, soft fruit.  The dates definitely come through, sweet and earthy.  A good amount of acid, but fairly smooth, light berries, big sticky dates, a touch of wood, tannins.  Long caramel and date into the finish, lingering wood and acid.  


2014 notes: Bottle .Pours a hazed amber with a thin white head. Soft berries, toffee, acid. Medium bodied, tart and full of berries. Long tart acid, a touch of acetone. 847315

Very Great beer. As good as black Angel. Aroma for me is weak, not bad just lacking. Nondescript. Dark BlackBerry tones, dates, dark fruit. Lightens as it fades to cherry tones mixed with oak. Mildly tart.
This poured a Ruby red color with a white head. Aroma was light vineous, dark fruit and skins, light lactic.notes. Flavor similar, grapes, cherry, skin and pit, light lactic and wine character. Nice.

Bottle in trade from Joe. Thanks buddy! Pours amber brownish red with a small off white head that dissipates quickly. Big sour aroma, some cheesiness, lactic sour, sweet berry fruit, vinous notes, vanilla oak. Nice. Flavor is sour up front with a big sweet juicy jammy berry finish that lingers long. Acidic with dry oakiness left on the palate. Really nice sour characteristics that don't get in the way of the juicy berries. Dry with medium body and high carbonation. Very good stuff.
GABF. Dark brownish/red pour, white head. Red wine and balsamic vinegar, cranberry, cherry, light toothpick. Nice brew. WW kills it almost every time.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2014 Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a tulip. Translucent crimson with small off-white head. Aroma is light blackberry, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is tart, some blackberry, some vinegar,  some red wine, and some dark fruit.  Not that much fruit, alcohol is covered, but a little heavy, hoped for more.
Encore une fois un liquide hautement minéral qui respire les petits fruits bleus et un acétique soyeux. Corps aminci, buvabilité amoindrie. Le profil vineux sort plus une fois tempéré,
Bottle from the brewery. Pours a hazy reddish amber with an off white head. Aromas of dark fruits, vinegar, red wine, slight oak. Taste is sour but drinkable. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours an orangey-brown garnet hue with small tan head that quickly subsides. Aroma is wine grapes, plums, oak barrel, vinegar, lemon zest, light cocoa, alcohol. Taste begins sweet with notes of milk chocolate and cherry before fading into spritzy red wine, caramel, orange, amaro, and lingering woody tannins. Fairly light and refreshing for the ABV. Nice, if not quite as rich or complex as other examples of this style.
Bottle to glass. Pours a medium brown, deep golden color with a light tan head. Mildly tart with a sour brown character. A bit more sour in the flavor with a touch of sour molasses malt. Very tasty.

500ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy ruby/amber with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of light sourness, light red wine and oak, light notes of blackberries and dark fruits, and some darker malts. Flavor the same with a pretty nice blend. Average texture. A cool beer but could be more sour.
Draft at the source, RBWG Asheville. Cloudy maroon color. Aroma of sweet and sour cherry. Taste reminds me of the old Rodenbach Grand Cru.

Bottle at home with Justin and Danielle. Pour is clear amber with a small tan head that quickly dissipated. Tangy, fruity, oaky, caramel, light toffee, blackberries and plums in the aroma. Taste is grapey, tangy, red berries, caramel, oak, and light spice with a semi-sour and sweet finish. Slick mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Not bad, but nothing spectacular.
Bottle share thanks to beechner224. Light tart and sweet fruity juicy aroma - lots of berry. Hazy redfish brown pour, tan head. Fruity, juicy, berry flavor, tart and sour character.

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy red hue with off white head. Aroma is plum, straw, lactic. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness with faint tartness and dry finish. Overall a nice brew.
Big red flanders. On tap at the brewpub. Lacy. Very drinkable though palate
Bottle thanks to Brandon. Pours a cloudy amber with small beige head. The aroma is oak, figs, dark fruit. Medium mouthfeel with light funk, dates, dry finish. Good
Beautiful dark pour with a big sour fruit nose. Taste is nicely complex with a big sour finish. Really nice.

500ml bottle pour semi clear dark violet red with a finger of foam. Nose is musty vinous wine soaked wood and tart berry, cherry, raisin funk. Taste has crisp balanced acidity with musty old wood berry funk, earthy red grape. Finish is tart berry, semi sweet winey fruit notes, wood funk. Solid sour.

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a rusty murky berry color with a finger of khaki foam. Lots of tart cherry, wet basement, leather, blackberries, some acetic funk and a lingering nutty date flavor that I really enjoyed. Those date flavors linger to easy the sour aspects out into the finish and a slightly bitter walnut cleans up the finish.

Sample @ Wicked Weed during RBWG, Asheville. Deep red pour with a large white head. Big jammy blackberry and cherry nose. Pennies, a bit of greek yogurt. Nice lactic funk, a touch of oak. Cherry fruit leather and a bit of unwashed red fruits. Dirt. Light body, supple. Nice stuff.
Bottle. Brune pour with tan head. Light fruit, sour cherries, tart aromas. Dark cherries, tartness, other light balsamic tones.
Sampled at the RBSG 2014. It poured a hazy copper color with a tan head. The aroma was of berries and some mild tartness. The taste was of sour berries, cherries, some tart and alcohol. Awesome.

500ml bottle. Pours a ruby red when held to the light, with almost no head. Aromas of red wine, oak, sour fruit. Taste is moderately tart with low bitterness. Flavors of sour berries, dry red wine, oak. Finishes pretty dry with a slight pucker. Pretty decent!

Bottle @ RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting. Thanks, Justin. Dark amber pour with a khaki head. Nose is kind of fruity and has a nice berry note to it. Sweet plum, some red wine, mild vinegar, and caramel. Hint of dates, too. Flavor has a decent balance of sweet and sour to it. Fairly heavy on sweet date, berry, and caramel. Somewhat acetic, but a lot of green apple sourness as well.
Sample at SRBG Grand Tasting 2014. Pours dark red with a decent beige head. Aroma of tart fruit and berries. Taste is tart cherries, tart berries, funk, and barrel. Very good.
Another true gem from the wicked week sours! You can really taste the red wine barrels come through on the finish. A really good sour beer.

Offering shared at RateBeer Grand Tasting 2014 (St. Louis, MO). Pours a deeper reddish copper glow, darker middle with subtle haze, frothy offwhite head with a firmer film, nice stick around and lacing. Aromas are a bit of red and biscuity malt, touches of bread and raspberry, blackberry, a bit seedy with middling fruit character. Touches of oak, gentle sweetness and lactic elements. A bit fruity and sweet. Initial is a bit sweet, fuzzy and decent carbonation. Some fruity berry, a touch sweet with some cobwebs, gentle funk and biscuit. Backend is a bit tart, more berry but still a little sweet overall. But flavorful, a bit dry and underdeveloped.

500 mL bottle shared by Hamp at Ale Alpharetta. Pours a dark, ruby brown, with a medium, beige head and good lacing. Nose of black cherries, peppercorns, caramel, and dates. Some berry sweetness and a sharp tartness. Heavy body and sticky. Overall, this is a pretty nice sour red, but it lacks a lot of depth.
500 ml bottle thanks to John. Pours with no carbonation. Cherry, vinegar, acidic. Nice.
Bottle from brewery. Pours an amber red, white head. Aroma us tart, fruity, yummy. Taste us sour first, tart, fruity, more yum. This is much more sour than the draft I had at the brewery. Very nice.

Pours a deep hazy reddish brown on tap with thing ring of bubbly tan brown head that leaves light lace. Aroma is big on the fruit with a nice sour cherry back end that lingers with vinegar acidity. Taste follows, big on the fruit but nice lingering sour. Amazing.

Draft at the brewery during RBWG tour. Pours a hazy amber/brown color with a medium sized bubbly off white head. The aroma and flavor have tart dark berries, lemon, vanilla, some acidity, caramel, plums, and dates. Medium bodied, with a dry, sour mouthfeel. Very drinkable sour. Another solid beer from this brewery which is showing the ability to do everything very well.

Sniffer at brewery. Good aRoma tart. Fruity. Red berry yeasty funk. A lot going on. Reddish brown color. Nice initial head faded to ring. No real lace. Sour flavor. Medium body. Smooth still mouthfeel. Tart finish. Wonderful stuff.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Hazed brown pour with white head and lace. Aroma is huge berry sour acidic. Sour acidic flavor. Very nice tart sour fruitiness. Medium body with good carbonation. ace

Draft after RBWG GT. Poured a hazy reddish body with an average sized off white head. Aroma and flavor of lemons, cherry, dry wood, cough medicine, tea leaves. Medium body with a lingering sour aftertaste. Once again this brewpub shows that its the tits.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a cloudy amber color with a medium off-white head. Notes of berries, lemon, vanilla, grapes, tea, brown sugar, plums, and dates. Light-medium bodied, with a dry, citrusy mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Excellent Flanders red. These guys seem to do everything well.

[ Tap ][ Wicked Weed ][ 4oz ][ Globe ][ Free ][ 2/8/14 ]
>> Clear amber red pour, weak yellow bubbles. Nose is mild bourbon barrel, vanilla, bright cherry pie. Taste is lime citric forward, brighter and saltier than the Dark Angel, but so citric tart that this could be reblended back into non soured base beer and cold crashed to give it some sugar to balance. Palate is drier, woody, heavy lemon lime. 
<!> too citric, could be reblended into base beer

Taste from a snifter at Wicked Weed during RBWG, thanks to whomever shared this! Mostly clear, dark red, slightly brown color. Little off-white head. Couple dots of lace. Awesome raspberry nose. Hint of chocolate. Great moderate to bigger sour taste, light sweet. Bigger body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Awesome raspberry sour!
One of my favorite all-time WW beers. Great acetic acid presence in this brew that stands out with the more robust wood aging. Nice work dudes.

On tap at the brewery, rbwg stop 
Clear amber with a medium sized beige head and good lacing. Aroma of brett and vinegar. Flavors of vinegar, Brett, acidic with a dry finish 
Nice and smooth

2014 RBWG At the brewerys downstairs tasting room.
Clear, red-tinged amber body with a white head.
Tart, acetic aroma.
The flavor is nicely tart and clean.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #9. Draft at the downstairs tap room. Pours a hazy copper color with a thin creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of sweet berries and mild tartness. The taste is sour berries, cherry Life Savers. Medium bodied, lingering tartness.
Draft. Pours reddish. Nose and taste of cranberry, sour cherry, light lactose and mild acidity. Good balance. Medium body.

On tap courtesy of Wicked Weed for RBWG. Shiny burgundy pour. Great aroma of plums, sherry, and oak. Full lactic flavor with horseblanket and a slight soapiness. Dry but tangy palate with sour blackberries in the finish. Awwwww yeahhhhh!

You have to like sour beers to like this beer and I do, so very much. They are very hard to come by , especially ones that are drinkable. This is a highly drinkable beer without any terrible after taste.
On tap at Wicked Weed. Pours a reddish brown color with white head. Sour, cherry, raspberry, fruity beer. Very good, approachable sour ale.

Sampled at the brewery. Reddish brown and hazy. Minimal soapy off white head. Fruit and vinous aroma. Complex. Wild yeast. First sip is a blam of sour fruit and wild yeast. Funkiness. So much fruit, wood, mushrooms, tree bark, dry bitterness. Grape peels on the finish.. So complex. A bit of a fizzy feel. Really good.

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear ruby with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is tart and acetic cherries, vinous notes, oak, light cookie and toast malt with stale earthy hops. Flavor is sour cherries, oak, light sweet malt, light hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

On tap @ Wicked Weed. Pours a reddish violet appearance with a white head. Bright berry / cherry, slightly acetic, leathery, a bit tannic aroma. Moderately tart. Nice fruit. Fairly dry. Low bitterness. Nice pucker. Kind of cool.
Draft at brew pub murky brown red. Nose sour,dates,macerated fruit. Taste tart and sour hip front, then cherries and fruit. Mid palate funk from sour. Fruity sour finish.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2014 On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy dark amber with an red hue and a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a rich blackberry notes that are slightly tart with a bit of acid bite. Flavor has rich blackberry with a bit of tartness that grows through the finish and a hint of wine in the finish,

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Draft - Sweet cherry with a slight sour grape and malt. Cloudy brown orange with a thin brown head. Sour grape, plum and a bit of cherry. Nice but a bit fresh, would be great with a bit of barrel age. Bottle - More flavor and edge.  Better.

Draft to snifter at Wicked Weed. Looks good; a hazy dark amber with foamy off-white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; tart and fruity with notes of blackberry. Tastes like it smells with a nice, lively mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Tap at SAMs and beer study. Pours a deep cloudy reddish brown with a light off white head. Very nice nose-lots of cherry skins, light oak, funky leather. Similar flavor. Quite yummy.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2014 On tap at Beer Study. Cloudy ruddy reddish orange with one finger of sudsy tan head. Nose is lightly acetic with cherry notes and some dry wood. Lightly estery. Flavor is nice and tart with some sharp sourness and tannic bitterness. Very nice bracing acidity and singular cherry notes and acidity. 

10/12/2014

Soft red orange pour with one finger of khaki tan head.  Very nice aroma, notes of fig and dark fruit with a round fruity sweetness. Acidity shows in the nose and prominently in the flavor.  Bright tin a tannic bitterness and dark fruit showing on the finish. Very light bodied and tart finish.
